intro: Elatostema sublaxum var. cabadbarense, commonly known as the narrow-leaved elatostema, is a small herbaceous plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes nettle and related species. The plant is characterized by its thin, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its flowering stems produce small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences.
